page.title: 06Housing
page.content: In Rusper there are several very old houses.{Ghyll Manor}dates from C15 and is on the site of the Nunnery founded in the C13.{"The Star"}and{"The {Plough", Averys}and{Church Row,}are all C16 Sussex timberframe buildings. The village was extended during the C19 and again after the First World War.Some modern executive housing and luxury retirement bungalows have been built recently.Most buildings are {owner occupied}but there are 2 small {Local Authority Council Estates}built in the 1950s one of bungalows the other of semi-detatched houses. In the rest of the area the main type of housing is detatched,on sizeable plots and privately owned.There are 2 {tied semi-detatched cottages}on Baldhorns Park Farm.The oldest house is in Lambs Green ( built in 1341) and still has many{medieval features}.
